title: WTM adds food tourism focus
text:
WTM adds food tourism focus 16 July 2015 Save 
World Travel Market will be taking on a new flavour at this year’s London show following a new deal with the World Food Travel Association (WFTA). 
As a result of the agreement, WFTA executive director Erik Wolf will give two seminar sessions on the subject of food tourism with the titled Food and Drink Travel: The Hidden Harvest and New Trends in Food and Drink Travel 
He said: “We’re delighted to have the opportunity to bring food travel education to WTM. Food and drink have become a critical focus for most travellers. 
“There is a lot that businesses and destinations everywhere can be doing to leverage food and drink as tools for economic development. Food and drink should be the foundation of all tourism development.” 
WTM London, senior exhibition director, Simon Press added: “WTM has focused on food tourism in the past, but never to this degree. 
“Interest in food tourism keeps increasing every year making it an ever-important topic for the travel industry.”
